newsitem.title: UK: Royalblue soars to premium on LSE debut.
newsitem.headline: Royalblue soars to premium on LSE debut.

text.p: Shares in software supplier Royalblue Plc surged on Monday to a 27 percent premium to their issue price on their first day of dealings on the London Stock Exchange, dealers said.
Royalblue shares, issued at 170p, climbed 46-1/2p to 216-1/2p by 1108 GMT in volume of over 2.5 million shares.
The shares traded as high as 235p soon after dealings began at 0730 GMT with dealers reporting active trade.

Royalblue, who supplies trading support software for dealers in international financial markets, raised 5.2 million stg via an institutional placing and said the float would help attract high calibre employees.
The company made a pre-tax profit of over two million stg to the year to December 31, 1996, and last week said it had signed its biggest contract to date with investment bank BZW.
